intro: Adenosma elongata, commonly known as the slender adenosma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and India. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent yellow corona. Adenosma elongata is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
